However, there is no specific verb form of 'to chrismate'. In general, you can use words like "consagrar", "ordenhar", "consecrar" or "batizar" (if referring specifically to baptizing). For example, instead of saying "I want to chrismate him/herself as mayor," you would say something like: "Quero consagr√°-lo/a como prefeito."

It might also be worth noting that some English words related to holy oils and such are borrowings from Latin, which itself has had influence on European languages, including Portuguese. So if your word doesn't work out, try thinking about whether there could be a similar concept expressed through other synonyms or compounds. And remember - sometimes there isn't a direct equivalent for everything! Language evolution happens for many reasons, after all. :)
